modalFeedback.p: Option H (Prolonged partial thromboplastin and bleeding time) is correct. Von Willebrand Factor (vWF) has three roles: (i) its expression in the vessel wall binds to the GP1b receptor on the platelet surface, bringing platelets into contact with subendothelium; (ii) independently platelets also contain vWF which becomes available once platelets are activated, assisting in that binding to the subendothelium; (iii) and vWF binds Factor VIII, preventing its destruction, and therefore affects bleeding time and intrinsic pathway.
